Message.Msg: Obama has offered a balanced approach to the budget, multiple times. They prefer to stand by Grover Norquist and protect their old age benefits. I don't know what else to tell you. You don't understand what is going on here, and I expect willfully so.

Topic.Title: On the third day of sequester Obama gave to me:

Message.Msg: "You know as well as I do that the Federal spending needs to be cut in half." No, I do not know that wilkes. Federal spending will continue to grow, mainly to finance Medicare, Social Security and other old age benefits. What we are trying to figure out is how to pay for the boomer retirement. Will it be by cuts to those programs? By gutting everything else? By increasing taxes on boomers themselves (high income earners and retirees drawing down 401ks and pensions)? Or by increasing taxes on working people? Or some combination? This is a fight between the old and the young, and the old boomers are quickly losing the voting power they had previously. That is why they have resorted to the tactics we see from the Tea Brains.

Topic.Title: On the third day of sequester Obama gave to me:

Message.Msg: We have sequester because Obama will not agree to anything but his ideal; he will not negotiate, he will not instruct the member of his Party in Congress to submit any alternative programs that have anything but his original demands included. He won’t even stay in town to meet with the members of Congress for more than an hour and then asks them to approve his programs and offers no other solutions. The Republicans in the house have submitted three alternatives to sequester to the Senate for consideration and Harry won't allow them to come up for a vote; just like he won't allow a budget to come up for a vote. The Republicans say not to the same programs the Democrats bring forward because the new ideas are simply the old ideas restated. Obama approved sequester and now wants to change the game rules. He doesn't have the words compromise or negotiate in the vocabulary. He also does not understand the definition of leadership.

Topic.Title: On the third day of sequester Obama gave to me:

Message.Msg: Really? Really? OK, OK, I am really sorry folks, but I can't resist, it is just too easy. "Obviously you've never worked with a budget." And neither has the president or his party for the last four years. Fact for ricky: The democrat controlled senate and the president have not offered or passed a budget in the last four years, contrary to the Republican controlled congress, which has met its legal obligation by passing several budgets and sending them to the senate for resolution. Folks, maybe to live in ricky's world of denial is OK for some, but I choose to learn the facts and not dwell on the hyperbole. "In your heart you know he is right." The Frogg

Topic.Title: NoBama and the Man

Message.Msg: The Quote of the Decade: "The fact that we are here today to debate raising America's debt limit is a sign of leadership failure. It is a sign that the US Government cannot pay its own bills. It is a sign that we now depend on ongoing financial assistance from foreign countries to finance our Government's reckless fiscal policies. Increasing America's debt weakens us domestically and internationally. Leadership means that, 'the buck stops here.' Instead, Washington is shifting the burden of bad choices today onto the backs of our children and grandchildren. America has a debt problem and a failure of leadership. Americans deserve better." ~ Senator Barack H. Obama, March 2006 It was so nice of him to give us this great quote for posterity

Topic.Title: On the third day of sequester Obama gave to me:

Message.Msg: The President has proposed budgets. I don't know what else to tell you. Go to the Office of Management and Budget page on the White House website and you'll find extensive information on his 2013 budget proposal. I'm sure reality isn't what you're interested in, but there it is. The budget process has been preempted by the crisis politics of the Tea Brains. Contrary to your statement, Republicans do not control Congress. They hold a slim majority in the House of Representatives, and that is all. Congress has not passed a budget. Normally, this would lead to some cooperation, in hopes of recapturing the center in American politics and possibly future electoral success. See Newt, 1990s. This House has passed empty political statements so hacks like you can make posts like this. But their goal continues to be obstruction. They should be working with the Senate to pass a budget--not passing their own political statements. See Newt, 1990s. But they have not done so. Because they're controlled by Grover Norquist and a bunch of stubborn old morons shouting about things they don't understand. Like budgeting.

Topic.Title: Another funny from "Organizing For Action"

Message.Msg: When you say "No one wants to cut spending 50%" you are ignoring the entire T-Party. The 1990s plan won't work now because we are missing economic growth and long-term spending cuts. The only thing we have is revenue increases and that can't make it on its own. Any open minded review of current spending will result in finding far more than 50% of it unnecessary.

Topic.Title: On the third day of sequester Obama gave to me:

Message.Msg: "If you want to reduce entitlement spending how about considering cuts for those on the government dole that have paid zero or very few tax dollars for the benefits they receive and see increased whenever they add a new mouth to feed." Because those people don't make up a significant part the Federal budget. They are largely a figment of your imagination. Even the programs you think you are referring to don't make up a significant part of the Federal budget, and they are not growing nearly as fast a old age benefits. You are simply not going to balance the budget on these programs. Despite what you've been told there is simply not that kind of money spent on these programs. Nevertheless, you are doing exactly what I described above. You want to cut those programs that benefit working and young people to pay for old age benefits, and to pay for tax cuts that generally favor retirees and people earning the highest incomes of their lives. If you want to cut those things, cut them to pay for payroll tax cuts or infrastructure spending. That I can talk about. But by no means should you expect working people and younger generations to see their futures gutted to pay for the mistakes of the past.

Topic.Title: On the third day of sequester Obama gave to me:

Message.Msg: Please stop referring to "the Federal budget". It has been over 4 years since we had one. What we have now is unauthorized Federal Spending and 46% of it is borrowed money. That is why we need a 50% cut in spending.

"Any open minded review of current spending will result in finding far more than 50% of it unnecessary." I don't think you know what open-minded means.
